Issues.Title: Update chokidar 3.5.3 ‚Üí 3.6.0 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è chokidar (3.5.3 ‚Üí 3.6.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/paulmillr/chokidar) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/paulmillr/chokidar/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

3.6.0

What's Changed

  • fix readyCount logic by @JLHwung in #1288
  • handle MustScanSubDirs by @MarcCelani-at in #1197
  • update fs.FSWatcher types to satisfy nodejs versions >= 16; fixes #1299 by @ben-polinsky in #1300

New Contributors

  • @Mutahhar made their first contribution in #1226
  • @zqianem made their first contribution in #1242
  • @JLHwung made their first contribution in #1288
  • @MarcCelani-at made their first contribution in #1197
  • @ben-polinsky made their first contribution in #1300

Full Changelog: 3.5.3...3.6.0

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 22 commits:

  • Release 3.6.0.
  • Add github ci autopublish
  • Merge pull request #1300 from ben-polinsky/fix-fswatcher-types-1299
  • fix formatting
  • update fs.FSWatcher types to satisfy node versions >= 16; fixes #1299
  • Merge pull request #1197 from MarcCelani-at/handleMustScanSubDirs
  • Merge pull request #1288 from JLHwung/fix-ready-count
  • ready call # is unfortunately platform specific
  • fix readyCount logic
  • Adjust funding field in pkg
  • Enable GitHub Sponsors
  • Merge pull request #1242 from zqianem/fix/tests
  • Fix test case using unsupported option for Node 8
  • Fix `close` tests
  • Merge pull request #1226 from Mutahhar/patch-1
  • Update README.md
  • Merge pull request #1198 from XhmikosR/rm-unused-deps
  • Merge pull request #1199 from XhmikosR/patch-1
  • Update CI config
  • Remove unused devDependencies
  • move to constants
  • handle MustScanSubDirs

Issues.Title: üö® [security] Update postcss-loader 4.3.0 ‚Üí 8.1.0 (major)
Issues.Body:
üö® Your current dependencies have known security vulnerabilities üö® This dependency update fixes known security vulnerabilities. Please see the details below and assess their impact carefully. We recommend to merge and deploy this as soon as possible!
Here is everything you need to know about this upgrade. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è postcss-loader (4.3.0 ‚Üí 8.1.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/webpack-contrib/postcss-loader) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/webpack-contrib/postcss-loader/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

Too many releases to show here. View the full release notes.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by more commits than we can show here.

#### ‚ú≥Ô∏è webpack (4.46.0 ‚Üí 5.90.1) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/webpack/webpack)
Security Advisories üö®

üö® Cross-realm object access in Webpack 5

Webpack 5 before 5.76.0 does not avoid cross-realm object access. ImportParserPlugin.js mishandles the magic comment feature. An attacker who controls a property of an untrusted object can obtain access to the real global object.

Release Notes

Too many releases to show here. View the full release notes.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 32 commits:

  • chore(release): 5.90.1
  • perf: reuse VM context across webpack magic comments
  • fix(types): update
  • fix: browsers versions of ECMA features
  • perf: optimize `numberHash` using 32-bit FNV1a for small ranges, 64-bit for larger
  • chore(deps): bump codecov/codecov-action from 3 to 4
  • chore(deps): bump codecov/codecov-action from 3 to 4
  • Reuse VM context across webpack magic comments
  • Update test cases
  • Adjust threshold
  • Optimize numberHash using 32-bit FNV1a
  • fix: more for other features
  • fix: async function support in browserslist
  • fix: correct preOrderIndex and postOrderIndex
  • fix: add fallback for MIME mismatch error in async wasm loading
  • perf: optimize compareStringsNumeric
  • chore: update snapshots
  • fix: handle instantiateStreaming resolved branch
  • refactor(types): more
  • Optimize compareStringsNumeric
  • chore: update test cases
  • fix: add fallback for MIME mismatch error in async wasm loading
  • chore(types): more
  • fix: correct preOrderIndex and postOrderIndex
  • chore(types): more
  • chore(types): more
  • fix: set `unmanagedPaths` in defaults
  • chore: fix cspell
  • chore(types): improve
  • chore: fix lint command
  • chore: refactor jest configuration
  • fix: set `unmanagedPaths` in defaults

Issues.Title: Sort arbitrary properties alphabetically across multiple class lists
Issues.Body:
Fixes https://github.com/tailwindlabs/prettier-plugin-tailwindcss/issues/246

In Tailwind we sort classes alphabetically before processing to produce a deterministic order. And, when we encounter an arbitrary property we register it _at that time_ so that's the order it'll take when sorting. In most cases this is fine because we sort up front, however, in the Prettier plugin we don't know all classes up front ‚Äî each individual class list is sorted separately but uses the same internal context for performance reasons. This means that we need to do some extra bookkeeping to ensure they're sorted consistently regardless of the order of individual class lists or files scanned.

This PR does this bookkeeping and will sort classes to ensure that the arbitrary properties are always alphabetical when handled by the prettier plugin even scross separate class lists or files.

Now given these two files, a.jsx and b.jsx:

```jsx
// a.jsx
export default function ComponentA() {
  return <div className="[--fg:#fff]" />
}
```

```jsx
// b.jsx
export default function ComponentB() {
  return <div className="[--bg:#111] [--bg_hover:#000] [--fg:#fff]" />
}
```

If you format each individual one with prettier or format all of them at one time the order of the properties will no longer flip-flop between these two lists:
```
[--bg:#111] [--bg_hover:#000] [--fg:#fff]
```

```
[--fg:#fff] [--bg:#111] [--bg_hover:#000]
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Sort arbitrary properties alphabetically across multiple class lists" (#12911)

Issues.Title: Accent Color not work in 3.4.1 Version
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
3.4.1

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
  "devDependencies": {
    "@tailwindcss/forms": "^0.5.7",
    "@tailwindcss/typography": "^0.5.10",
    "autoprefixer": "^10.4.17",
    "eslint": "^8",
    "eslint-config-next": "14.1.0",
    "eslint-config-prettier": "^9.1.0",
    "postcss": "^8.4.35",
    "tailwindcss": "^3.4.1"
  }

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
V20.8.0

**What browser are you using?**

All Browser Chrome, Mozila and Edge

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows 11

**Reproduction URL**
localhost 

**Describe your issue**

use Tailwind in nextjs and use code:
      <label>
        <input type="checkbox" className="accent-red-500" checked /> Customized
      </label>
      <label>
        <input type="checkbox" className="accent-pink-500" checked /> Customized
      </label>
but not working, Other Tailwind versions are correct.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Accent Color not work in 3.4.1 Version" (#12933)

Issues.Title: Play CDN does not work as expected
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->
In your docs there is saying 
```
Use the Play CDN to try Tailwind right in the browser without any build step. The Play CDN is designed for development purposes only, and is not the best choice for production.
```
Where all the rest classes, like `container`, `grid` etc, it does not work at all. Your docs does not say on Pay CDN about anything else require to do. Are `container` or `grid` something special to the framework? 
If that functionality does not work - why you even suggesting it.
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: https://cdn.tailwindcss.com/3.4.1

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

For example: Play CDN

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v20

**What browser are you using?**

For example: Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

For example: macOS

**Reproduction URL**

A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways.

A reproduction is **required** when filing an issue ‚Äî any issue opened without a reproduction will be closed and you'll be asked to create a new issue that includes a reproduction. We're a small team and we can't keep up with the volume of issues we receive if we need to reproduce each issue from scratch ourselves.

**Describe your issue**

Describe the problem you're seeing, any important steps to reproduce and what behavior you expect instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Play CDN does not work as expected" (#12935)

Issues.Title: 'has-*' modifier not working on label elements
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.4.1

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Svelte

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

20.8.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/D7TH0Gb3vV

If you try changing the `label` to a `div`, you will see that it displays correctly.

**Describe your issue**

When trying to apply a `has-*` modifier to a label element it doesn't work. At first I thought it had something to do with label being an inline element, but even after changing it to `flex`, the issue still persists.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "'has-*' modifier not working on label elements" (#12926)

Issues.Title: feat: add plus-darker support for mix-blend-mode
Issues.Body:
This PR adds 'plus-darker' support to mix-blend-mode.

One PR already added 'mix-blend-plus-lighter' (#8288) , but there should also be 'mix-blend-plus-darker' since blend mode also has a 'plus-darker' value that could be added last time. 

[mix-blend-mode on MDN lists all possible values](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mix-blend-mode)

From what I know, it seems only Safari supports `plus-darker` at the moment since this style is used heavily in macOS's vibrant visual style.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat: add plus-darker support for mix-blend-mode" (#12923)

Issues.Body:

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "No error when non existing class is used in Vue template" (#12908)

Issues.Title: Bug with Custom Selector and Styling Based on Sibling State Using peer Not Working
Issues.Body:
# Bug Report: Custom Selector and Styling Based on Sibling State Not Working ## Description I've encountered an issue when setting a custom selector in the Tailwind CSS configuration and applying styling based on sibling state. According to the Tailwind CSS documentation on [Configuration - Selector Strategy](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/configuration#selector-strategy), I set a custom selector in my Tailwind configuration as follows: ```javascript module.exports = { // Other configurations... important: '#app', }; ``` However, when attempting to apply styling based on sibling state as described in the documentation section on [Styling Based on Sibling State](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/hover-focus-and-other-states#styling-based-on-sibling-state), using the `peer` class does not work as expected. ### Example HTML structure ```html

I am visible if input gets focus

``` ### Expected Behavior The paragraph (`

`) tag should become visible when the `` element (marked with the `peer` class) receives focus, as per the Tailwind CSS `peer-focus` utility. ### Actual Behavior The `peer-focus` utility does not apply, and the paragraph remains hidden regardless of the `` element's focus state. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Set a custom selector in the Tailwind CSS configuration using the `important` property. 2. Apply the `peer` class to an input element and the `peer-focus:block` utility to a sibling element. 3. Focus on the input element and observe that the sibling element's visibility does not change as expected. This issue suggests that there might be a conflict or a bug when using a custom selector in combination with the `peer` utility for styling based on sibling state.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bug with Custom Selector and Styling Based on Sibling State Using peer Not Working" (#12907)

Issues.Title: üö® [security] Update css-loader 5.2.7 ‚Üí 6.10.0 (major)
Issues.Body:
üö® Your current dependencies have known security vulnerabilities üö® This dependency update fixes known security vulnerabilities. Please see the details below and assess their impact carefully. We recommend to merge and deploy this as soon as possible!
Here is everything you need to know about this upgrade. #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è webpack (4.46.0 ‚Üí 5.90.1) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/webpack/webpack)
Security Advisories üö®

üö® Cross-realm object access in Webpack 5

Webpack 5 before 5.76.0 does not avoid cross-realm object access. ImportParserPlugin.js mishandles the magic comment feature. An attacker who controls a property of an untrusted object can obtain access to the real global object.

Issues.Title: Exclude files from tailwind parsing by plugin
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.4.1

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

postcss 8.4.34 svelte 4.2.7, @sveltejs/kit 2.0.0, vite 5.0.3

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18.17.1

**What browser are you using?**

Brave

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://github.com/frontline-hq/tw-exclude-content

Reproduction steps:

```js
// Install
pnpm i
// run
pnpm run dev
```

Then visit the app in the browser and check for the file `app.css` in the network tab.
You will see that it includes the tw class `bg-blue-900`. 

**Describe your issue**

`content` configurations returned from tailwind plugins are not respected for excluded file globs.
D.h. the classes in the [file](https://github.com/frontline-hq/tw-exclude-content/blob/main/src/lib/file.tdc.ts#L1) should not be included in the css as specified [here](https://github.com/frontline-hq/tw-exclude-content/blob/main/tailwind.config.js#L10-L11)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Exclude files from tailwind parsing by plugin" (#12896)

Issues.Title: fix(corePlugins): more browser compatibility for rtl/ltr
Issues.Body:
I'd like to propose an improvement to the `rtl/ltr` core plugin that addresses compatibility issues on certain browsers and devices.

**Current Issue:**

The existing implementation uses the `:where` CSS selector to achieve bidirectionality support. While this approach offers certain advantages, it has limited browser compatibility, particularly on iPhone devices before September 2020. This can cause layout and rendering problems for users on these browsers.

**Proposed Solution:**

I propose replacing the `:where` selector with the `[dir="ltr"]` selector. This alternative:

- Offers broader browser compatibility, ensuring that the plugin functions correctly on all major browsers and devices, including older iPhones.
- Maintains the desired functionality of providing LTR/RTL support.
- Is generally considered a more widely supported and reliable approach for achieving bidirectionality.

**Benefits:**

By adopting this change, we can:

- **Improve user experience** for a wider range of users by ensuring consistent plugin functionality across different browsers and devices.
- **Reduce potential bugs and support issues** related to browser compatibility.
- **Align with standard practices** for achieving bidirectionality in CSS.

**Testing:**

I have thoroughly tested this change on various browsers and devices.  
These tests confirm that the `[dir="rtl"]` selector functions as expected and addresses the compatibility issues associated with `:where`.

**Request:**

I kindly request that you review my proposed change and consider merging this pull request to improve the plugin's compatibility and user experience. I am confident that this modification will have a positive impact on the project and its users.

Thank you for your time and consideration.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(corePlugins): more browser compatibility for rtl/ltr" (#12895)

Issues.Title: Group hover leaks when applying to SVG defs
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**Tailwind CSS version:** v3.2.4

**Framework:** Next.js 13.0.0

**Node.js version:** v20.3.0

**Browser:** Chrome, Firefox

**Operating System:** Windows

**Reproduction URL:** https://play.tailwindcss.com/hkfzY1h86v

**Describe your issue**

When using group hover with SVG defs (in my example a `<stop>` inside `<linearGradient>`, but it doesnt work in `<linearGradient>` itself too), the group causes a leak, in which every svg in the page is affected, and only the first hover works.

In my example there are 3 group divs each inside of a different flex container where the behaviour i just explained, happens.

It also breaks if they are on a grid, which was my initial use case that triggered this bug, i just removed the grid in the reproduction to display that the bug is not related to what container the groups are in.

Using [Named Groups](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/hover-focus-and-other-states#differentiating-nested-groups) also results in the same buggy outcome.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Group hover leaks when applying to SVG defs" (#12876)

Issues.Title: darkMode: 'class' feature not working with Tailwind CDN (v3.4.1)
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.4.1 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** CDN **What version of Node.js are you using?** CDN, so N/A **What browser are you using?** Firefox **What operating system are you using?** macOS **Reproduction URL** https://github.com/zulkufdemirhan/tailwind-dark-mode **Describe your issue** **Dark Mode On:** **Dark Mode Off:** 'darkMode: 'class'' feature is not working in conjunction with Tailwind CDN (v3.4.1). However, after removing the CDN, I ran it and it worked without CDN. - After setting up my project with Tailwind CLI, I'm adding Tailwind CDN additionally to use some features. This situation causes an issue with the 'darkMode' feature. - When I follow only the Tailwind CDN usage guidelines without installing Tailwind CLI, the 'darkMode' feature works.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "darkMode: 'class' feature not working with Tailwind CDN (v3.4.1)" (#12871)

Issues.Title: Prettier prevents using underscores in tokens or custom properties.
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** 3.4.0. **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** prettier 2.8 , VsCode, eslint-plugin-prettier. **Describe your issue** Prettier automatically escapes "useless" escaped characters. For example `"\_"` will be changed to `"_"`. However, tailwind uses underscores to represent text spaces in some cases. So for example ``` border-b-[length:theme(spacing[input_border_bottom_width])] border-b-[length:var(--input_border_bottom_width)] ``` Must be written ``` border-b-[length:theme(spacing[input\_border\_bottom\_width])] border-b-[length:var(--input\_border\_bottom\_width] ``` Because tailwind interprets `var(--input_border_bottom_width)` as `var(--input border bottom width)` However in JSX the following code ``` jsx return
``` will be replaced by this if you use prettier ``` jsx return
``` Given the fact that prettier is a very widely used tool in frontend I believe we should have a solution for this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Prettier prevents using underscores in tokens or custom properties." (#12865)

Issues.Title: Remove Webkit Search Cancel Button
Issues.Body: On Chrome and Safari webkit includes a cancel button that I think Preflight should hide. [MDN lists this cancel button as nonstandard][1] and Chrome and Sarafi both style this button differently. This appears to happen in macOS and linux. [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::-webkit-search-cancel-button Safari: Chrome: Firefox (no cancel button with Preflight): ![image (7)](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/61948088/a406ab49-69fe-40c3-b446-83fcf4cf937a) Co-authored-by: Brooks Johnson <2008881+bkjohnson@users.noreply.github.com>
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove Webkit Search Cancel Button" (#12835)

Issues.Title: Update sass 1.69.7 ‚Üí 1.70.0 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è sass (1.69.7 ‚Üí 1.70.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

1.70.0

To install Sass 1.70.0, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

JavaScript API

  • Add a sass.initCompiler() function that returns a sass.Compiler object which supports compile() and compileString() methods with the same API as the global Sass object. On the Node.js embedded host, each sass.Compiler object uses a single long-lived subprocess, making compiling multiple stylesheets much more efficient.

  • Add a sass.initAsyncCompiler() function that returns a sass.AsyncCompiler object which supports compileAsync() and compileStringAsync() methods with the same API as the global Sass object. On the Node.js embedded host, each sass.AsynCompiler object uses a single long-lived subprocess, making compiling multiple stylesheets much more efficient.

Embedded Sass

  • Support the CompileRequest.silent field. This allows compilations with no logging to avoid unnecessary request/response cycles.

  • The Dart Sass embedded compiler now reports its name as "dart-sass" rather than "Dart Sass", to match the JS API's info field.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 3 commits:

  • [Shared Resources] dart-sass implementation (#2134)
  • Support CompileRequest.silent of embedded protocol (#2160)
  • Use implementation name dart-sass for VersionResponse (#2156)

Issues.Title: TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'insertAfter')
Issues.Body:
Hello everyone,

we sometimes have a problem with the npx tailwindcss build in different instances:
![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/16542619/03bb407c-c4ea-44f6-a1eb-c03c05aff6cb)

After some investigation of the whole components css the error comes through as @apply font-bold. As soon as we remove this class the generation of the CSS runs.
![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/16542619/8ace2361-e039-45f0-b4ab-bfd278f7da4d)

However, we cannot explain how such a problem can occur. Does anyone have an idea how to debug this? 

Test on
NGINX 1.24.0 with PHP 8.2
NodeJs: v18.17.1 and 20.5.1 and 21.6.1

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ @tailwindcss/forms@0.5.7
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ @tailwindcss/typography@0.5.10
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ autoprefixer@10.4.17
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ browser-sync@3.0.2
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ postcss-import@14.1.0
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ postcss@8.4.33
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ tailwindcss@3.4.1

as well:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ @tailwindcss/forms@0.5.3
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ @tailwindcss/typography@0.5.7
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ autoprefixer@10.4.13
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ browser-sync@2.27.10
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ postcss@8.4.18
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ postcss-import@14.1.0
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ tailwindcss@3.2.4

Issues.Title: Position class is getting applied only at certain values (50)
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.4.1 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** SvelteKit with Svelte 5.0.0-next.1, I have followed the guide https://tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/sveltekit for installing & using TailwindCSS **What version of Node.js are you using?** v18.17.1 **What browser are you using?** Firefox & Chrome **What operating system are you using?** Windows 10 **Reproduction URL** Unfortunately I am unable to find a playground where I can put my code. I even tried this URL https://svelte.dev/repl/f2a988ddbd5644f18d7cd4a4a8277993?version=4.2.9. I use `import { browser } from '$app/environment';` in my code & get the error doe "$app" really exists! I am putting my whole code here (there is nothing confidential in there). ```

Hi,

Welcome Mario

Plumber

Mechanic

Engineer

I repair things.

``` **Describe your issue** The `left` position (with a arbitrary value) is working only with the vaule 50! I want to be able to position my element (in this case h1 element with class "be" which has the text "Mechanic"), The class gets applied to the position but the position does not change except for when the class is `left-[50%]`. I do not understand why it works only as the value 50% and not with other values. The other values can be see in the Dev tools. Out of curiosity I changed from `%` to `px` and the behavior is same! When I value is `50px` the `left` is applied, otherwise not. The expected behavior is for the `left` position (with a arbitrary value) to be applied at all times not only with value 50. Few pics below showing the issue Please have a look. This is my first Svelte & Tailwind project, so if I am doing something wrong, please let me know. Page when it loads ![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/92194668/44ed3ae9-9c11-4734-8c2b-f51b6f0399b7) Page when Slider is at 50% ![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/92194668/7ae50262-f6ae-4ec6-89aa-ed2f0026918d) Page when Slider is at a value other than 50% ![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/92194668/88453840-ec17-41d0-8079-c4afbaf917c1)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Position class is getting applied only at certain values (50)" (#12827)

Issues.Title: Incorrect spacing behavior in RTL
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

v3.4.1

Next.js 14.1.0, postcss-cli 8.4.33

v21.5.0

Chrome

Applying [Space Between](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/space) classes (such as `space-x-4`) to elements on an RTL page results in incorrect spacing behavior.
